page.title: 18FLAXLEY HAMLET.
page.content: The hamlet of {Flaxley }is at the extreme western end of our area. It lies between the main roads through Westbury-on-Severn and Micheldean,in the {Vale of Castiard}. There are only a handful of houses and the population is about 50. The village school closed in 1910. It had opened in 1848 as a church of England school and it shows clearly the decline of rural population. The school room is still used for some meetings, like the W.I. The church of St Mary the Virgin acts as a centre for community life. Each year a successful village fete is held to raise funds for the church. There is now a youth club, but there is neither pub nor Post Office. There was a Cistercian Abbey here in 1148, this is now a private house. It is thought that flax may have been processed here, hence the name.
